key.description: REQUIRED. The API key to which rate-limits will be applied. It can contain alphanumeric characters, the numbers zero through nine, '_' (underscore) and '-' (dash) characters. Additionally, it can contain expression syntax to extract values from the incoming request headers, body, or JWT token (if an Authorization Rule is also applied).

plan.description: OPTIONAL. This is a reference to the associated rate plan which is used to apply rate limits. Static API keys do not need a rate plan assignment here because they are already assigned to a rate plan. On creation or update, either the 'id' or 'slug' property is required (not both).

id.description: The immutable identifier of the associated rate plan.

slug.description: The url-safe name of the associated rate plan.

onError.description: OPTIONAL. Used only for static API keys when an API key is not valid (not predefined).

title: ApiKeyRuleDefinitionDto
description: An API Key Rule is a core component of a Policy Definition which defines which API keys to apply rate limits to.
